title: Aural set, In the Mood - chorus chord progression

content.question: Which of the following represents the chord progression of the chorus?

choices.label: The figure shows chord progressions in root position. The progressions are Major one, Major fourth, Major one, Major one, Major four, Major five, Major one, Major Five, Major one, Major four and Major one.

The figure shows chord progressions in root position. The progressions are Major one, Major one, Major one, Major one,  Major Five, Major one, Major four, Major five, Major one, Major four, Major one.

The figure shows chord progressions in root position. The progressions are Major one, Major five, Major one, Major one, Major four, Major Five, Major one, Major one, Major five, Major five, Major one.
The figure shows chord progressions in root position. The progressions are Major one, Major one, Major one, Major one, Major four, Major four, Major one, Major one, Major five, Major five, Major one.

content.answer: The figure shows chord progressions in root position. The progressions are Major one, Major one, Major one, Major one, Major four, Major four, Major one, Major one, Major five, Major five, Major one.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Use symbols and terms to describe melodic, harmonic, and rhythmic relationships in performed music. (This skill is applied in describing these elements in a full musical context.)
